title: Ivanka Trump and family go to synagogue for Shemini Atzeret
text:
Advertisement

Ivanka Trump and her husband Jared Kushner enjoyed some quality time with their three children on Monday as they headed to their local synagogue to celebrate the Jewish holiday of Shemini Atzeret.

The couple took advantage of the mild fall weather and strolled to the Friends of Lubavitch Synagogue, which is located in their ritzy Kalorama neighborhood in Washington D.C.

Ivanka, 37, and Jared, 38, walked alongside each other as their children — Arabella, eight, Joseph, six, and Theodore, three — rode their scooters on the sidewalk.

Scroll down for video

Family affair: Ivanka Trump, 37, and her husband Jared Kushner, 38, were seen walking their three children to the Friends of Lubavitch Synagogue in Washington, D.C. on Monday while celebrating the Jewish holiday of Shemini Atzeret

All together: Arabella, eight, Joseph, six, and Theodore, three, rode their scooters, though the couple's youngest son spent some time walking with them

Outfit of the day: Ivanka wore a tan trench with a black ribbon tie, a black mock-turtleneck dress, thigh-high black boots, and a black headband to hold her hair back

At one point, little Theodore opted to stay back with his parents and hold hands with his father, who carried his scooter for him.

The trip to the synagogue has become somewhat of a routine for the family, as they walked there last Monday and Tuesday while celebrating Sukkot.

The couple and their children were once again decked out for the occasion, with Ivanka donning a tan trench with a black ribbon tie, a black mock-turtleneck dress, and thigh-high black boots.

The first daughter wore her blonde bob pulled back with a black headband, which showed off her pearl stud earrings.

Lookalike: The couple's eldest son Joseph was the spitting image of his dad in navy quilted vest and khaki pants

Doting mom: When Joseph stepped out of their front gate, Ivanka followed close behind with his helmet in her hand

Waiting game: Ivanka was seen putting the helmet on Joseph's head while he stood on blue scooter

Jared, who wore sweaters and khakis during his visits to the synagogue last week, was more dressed up this time around.

The White House senior adviser donned a navy wool coat over a slate-gray suit that was paired with a white button-down shirt, a navy tie, and black dress brogues.

His sons also wore navy blue pieces and looked just like him in their outfits.

Joseph sported a navy quilted vest over a white button-down and khaki dress pants, while Theodore had a navy cardigan over a white button-down and navy dress pants. Both boys wore matching navy blue penny loafers.

Safety first: Joseph, who celebrated his sixth birth last week, smiled as his mom securely fastened the strap to his helmet

Special bond: The first daughter enjoyed a sweet moment with her eldest son before he rode off on his scooter

Fancy moves: Joseph was seen squatting down as he scooted on the side walk

Hamming it up: The little boy made a funny expression and threw his hand over his face during the short ride to the synagogue

Arabella, meanwhile, donned a black and white patterned sweater dress and black Mary Jane flats.

All three children were wearing helmets as they happily rode their scooters on the sidewalk ahead of their parents.

When they stepped out of the front gate of their D.C. home, Ivanka was actually seen fastening Joseph's helmet securely on his head, while Arabella was with their family dog Winter.

The couple's only daughter held onto the pooch's leash and even asked the photographers outside to take her pet's picture, resulting in a series of portraits of Winter, which fans have speculated is a cross between a Siberian Husky and a Pomeranian.

Tuckered out? At one point, little Theodore opted to stay back with his parents and hold hands with his father, who carried his scooter for him

Still her baby: Ivanka leaned over to hold her youngest son's hand while her older children scooted ahead of them

Proud dad: Jared smiled as he looked down at his son, who was holding his hand tightly

Mini-me: Little Theodore wore a navy cardigan over a button-down and navy pants with navy penny loafers

Look of love: Ivanka lovingly cradled the back of her little boy's head as he walked beside them

Winter was given to Arabella for her eighth birthday on July 17, and she clearly adores her new pet.

The Trump-Kushner family was last seen walking to synagogue on Tuesday as they continued their celebration of Sukkot.

Ivanka and Jared put on a public display of affection while strolling through their upscale neighborhood with their kids in tow. Arabella walked alongside them, while Joseph and Theodore rode scooters.

The couple couldn't take their eyes off of each other as they walked with their arms wrapped around each other's waists. When they weren't holding each other close, the White House senior advisers walked hand in hand.

Ivanka and her family were seen walking to the Friends of Lubavitch Synagogue together last Monday as well.

On the go: Arabella scooted past her youngest brother as he walked with their father

Paying attention: Jared stood in the middle of the street as he made sure his children crossed safely on their scooters

Protected: Jared walked alongside his daughter while their Secret Service detail watched nearby

Wait up! Theodore, who was the last to cross the street, trailed behind his older brother and sister

All dressed up: Arabella donned a black and white patterned sweater dress and black Mary Jane flats

Beloved pet: Before they left their home, Arabella stepped out with their family dog Winter, who was given to her as a gift for her eighth birthday in July

Strike a pose: Arabella asked the photographers outside her home to take her pet's picture, resulting in a series of portraits of Winter, which fans have speculated is a cross between a Siberian Husky and a Pomeranian

The day also happened to be Joseph's sixth birthday, and all three children were dressed up for the special occasion.

Sukkot is a week-long holiday that falls five days after Yom Kippur. It celebrates the gathering of the harvest and the protection that the Israelites received when they left Egypt.

During the first two days of the holiday, work is forbidden, candles are lit in the evening, and meals are followed by Kiddush, a ceremony of prayer and blessing over wine.

Ivanka and Jared returned to work on Wednesday and traveled to Texas with her father, President Donald Trump, on Thursday to celebrate the opening of a new Louis Vuitton workshop.

They took Monday morning off to celebrate Shemini Atzeret, the holiday that immediately follows the seventh day of the Jewish festival of Sukkot.

Work: Ivanka and Jared (not pictured) traveled to Texas last Thursday to celebrate the opening of a new Louis Vuitton workshop with her father, President Donald Trump, and LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault

Love in the air: Ivanka and Jared put on a loved up display when they headed to Friends of Lubavitch Synagogue while celebrating Sukkot with their children last Tuesday

Happy as can be: The couple's two sons rode scooters in front of them while their daughter Arabella (not pictured) walked next to them

Off they go! Ivanka and Jared also headed to their local synagogue with their kids last morning. Sukkot ended at sundown on October 20. Shemini Atzeret is the holiday that immediately follows the seventh day of Sukkot

It is a separate, yet connected, holy day devoted to the spiritual aspects of Sukkot.

This year, Shemini Atzeret began at sunset on October 20 and will end at sundown on October 22.

Ivanka converted to Judaism in 2009 to marry Jared, an Orthodox Jew, and they are raising their three children Orthodox as well.

The family's stroll to the synagogue has become something of an annual tradition since they moved from New York to D.C. at the start of 2017 when Ivanka and Jared took on official roles in the Trump administration.

In October of that year, the family was seen making their way to the synagogue with all three of the children riding scooters, while Ivanka and Jared strolled alongside them.

Then, in October 2018, Ivanka was pictured taking Arabella, Joseph, and Theodore to the synagogue for Shemini Atzeret.
description: Ivanka, 37, and her husband Jared Kushner, 38, were seen walking their three children to the Friends of Lubavitch Synagogue in Washington, D.C. on Monday.
